-e ---

Even though the exact pronunciation fluctuated significantly over dialects and centuries, we have a quite stable core in many Egyptian and Akkadian words:

In general the more syllables a recorded word has, the greater the confidence in a relative continuity of the pronunciation:

word | meaning | preserved variants
--|---|---

preserved proper nouns:
ğ“ƒ€ ğ“…®ğ“„¿ ğ“‚‹ ğ“¤ ğ“¡ ğ“„¿ ğ“˜ ğ“‡‹ lake â€˜bairkati Arabic â€˜Birketâ€˜ !! Ø¨Ø±ÙƒØ© vs Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø­ÙŠØ±Ø©

also see wanderwort

Many Sumerian and Akkadian words found their way into Semitic branches almost unchanged:

Egyptian locations

Many Egyptian locations have their names derived from ancient names:
